messages.content: Hello, i would like to go infinite as guardian again.
me when I put a rare card into uncommon
on a character with zero costs!!!
Way too strong, “Next turn, draw a card” would be better

messages.content: energy is worth more than draw 1:1
guardian has absolutely ZERO energy gen as well
beyond citrine
the problem is like...  you can just socket quartz into 0 costs

Before you think about it:
Stasis is energy cheating, not energy gen
there's a difference
also Quartz has 0 cost to having it floating around in the deck
all other gems do, even Onyx and Citrine
the setup required is what splits the rarity with <amber> and citrine
I have heard the idea of rare quartz but i think that misses the point
well, that and it just makes socketed cards on the whole alot worse, as there are less gems around
Stasis also acts as pseudo-exhaust so you can go infinite with 2x Quartz even easier

fun fact:
Dark Core makes it REAL exhaust
lol
dank core is not on the bot because the exporter cant find it

either way:
Dark Core makes all orbs dark orbs
including Stasis
`Dark Core [Boss] [Relic]: All orbs become dark orbs (Includes statis cards and gremlins).`
funnily enough, this is actually a Brainlets discovery that can be applied to Guardian as well
the interaction with grems is great
first room you walk into instakills all of your grems except the one you have selected
and all you get back are a bunch of dark orbs
carbon used dark core as extreme damage
and only died because giant head
Anyway I am of the opinion that Quartz is the best gem you can find as Guardian, free draw is ridiculously strong in this game
i would commonly take Citrine and Onyx over it tbh
occasionally amber too
its good, but you want to see it early enough to go infinite, or start working towards it
Draw helps Guardian scale as it lets you draw the temp buff cards and the debuff removal cards at the same time
later on its value isnt actually all that great
then again, naked citrine/onyx/amber not the greatest
You can take Quartz and never socket it and it has minimal downside
a very big selling point of Quartz is that naked quartz has 0 downside
beyond nob
its definetly a card where people hyperfixate on the best case and dont consider the average tbh
chosen gets stopped by any debuff reduction card
i would honestly like to see the gem winrates 🧐
you would get a bunch of crap
because metrics can't track socketed gems
only naked ones
Oh well thats erm
Lol

this card at its very worst makes half of guardian's card pool draw 1 for free. At it's best quarts is drawing multiple cards, again free. Unlike other gems since quarts will just replace itself, theres almost no downside to taking a quarts since it wont even temporarily weaken you in all but 2 fights in the game. Its the strongest gem in a vacuum, the others can only be stronger in specific situations on the right cards (such as citrine making twin strike free).

I don't really value going infinite on guardian, since I'm confident my deck will be able to win if I just take cards instead of skipping with the hope of setting up an infinite that might not come. Its not really like watcher where her rushdown infinite is built out of some of the best cards she has already and you can just still win if your plan fails.

quartz is also good enough to take even with snecko eye. Even though that relic makes quarts bad to have before it's socketed; more draw is always welcome on guardian. Most other gems I hesitate on taking multiple floors in advance when I have that relic.
citrine has a downside, quartz has literally zero downside
either way, swap oynx and quartz
oynx is already in competition with resilient plate
I'm honestly not sure how much of the brokenness of Virtuous Repentance is because it retains and how much would uncommon onyx actually break Guardian
Not technically energy generation, but stasis/acceleration is energy generation adjacent and greatly increases the amount of cards you can play.
I already mentioned that it's energy cheating, not energy gen
I mean literal "gain E" cards
and gremlins

I'd say it's definitely above average, however guardian has <suspension> upgraded for infinites, so needing this for infinites isn't as necessary. And if it's not on a 0 cost card, this gem loses a lot of the value it has. I'd say both rares are better, and situationally amethyst and amber could be better (although I do think overall quartz is better than those two)

embeds.title: Suspension
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 0 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

 (Draw a card.)
Place a card in your hand into **Stasis.**
[ **Socket** ]

messages.content: I like this idea, just for the fact that I think debuff reduction should be more likely to get, as it is a core part of the character's kit and there is a pretty high likelihood you just don't ever see it in a run.

Overall my opinion on quartz is that yes 1 draw is good, but it's on a character that already has the ability to play a ton of cards in one turn. I think this gem doesn't have as high of a ceiling as some other gems, however there is almost zero downside so outside of opportunity cost there is almost never a reason to not add it to your deck.
Makes slimeboss so much worse awesome
Citrine literally goes infinite with 2 cards
you could do funny business with split+ becoming 0 cost channel 1 dark
Well technically 3 because you need to put overload back into stasis with sussy
Oh wait it's not infinite because suspension no longer draws
Actually scratch what I said it's not infinite lol

Certainly this particular gem lets you take it without having to worry about how/where you will socket it in the future. That alone is quite powerful, as the socketing of gems is a significant part of guardians power, and it's supposed to have the inherent risk of taking on fights with weak/airy cards in your deck that can cause you to take more damage before reaching the next campfire. The only real risks here are gremlin nob gaining strength and chosen shuffling in a dazed with hex, but even hex is easily removed by guardian with any of the debuff removal tools. Watcher 3 just isn't that punishing to spam cards into, and you will have time to socket before facing neow.

As for the actual affect, it can certainly be used to work towards infinites fairly often, and is otherwise just extremely solid value once socketed, letting whatever you put this in replace itself. I don't have much experience going for infinites on guardian, but this is one of the easier ways to create a draw positive loop. I just don't find infinites all that fun to actually play out, and guardian has plenty of other ways to win while building a more interesting deck. The issue with this card is just that it's too free in my opinion, there's essentially no situation in which you wouldn't take it, it always improves your deck, and it helps build hyper efficient cards/infinites via socketing eventually. I think it could be a candidate for becoming rare, but it could also just be reworked entirely, I just don't like the idea of value being this free. It's fine to have a few exhausting rares like dragons trove, offering, or adrenaline that give powerful one-shot effects, and exist as cards that you are basically always happy to see, but having that sort of affect on an uncommon that doesn't exhaust, and eventually folds into another card to make it even more condensed/powerful feels wrong to me.
@SamLL Let the master speak on the topic of Guardian infinites
Having quartz exhaust by base actually sounds like an interesting way to balance the card
Exhaust until it's slotted into something

This is the #1 guardian infinite card, even more so than Suspension+ despite being rarer, and is central to the Guardian infinite identity. Learning how much of the guardian kit suits itself well to infinites is honestly the most fun I have had in Downfall. Just socketing Quartz in anything is a tempting payoff, and as people say, playing it on its own is usually pretty close to 0 downside (similar to Finesse, Deep Breath, Flash of Steel, and Battle Trance from the base game, among others).

To me, Downfall being wilder, wackier, and more prone to infinites than the base game is a core part of its brand identity and what drew me into the mod. _Personally_ I think it would be quite sad to crush this aspect of the Guardian and the mod would be significantly poorer for it - more balanced and less fun.
<Battle Trance> has a minor downside, that being the "no drawing for the rest of the turn", that makes grabbing more than 2 very sus

embeds.title: Battle Trance
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Draw 3 (4) cards.
You cannot draw additional cards this turn.

messages.content: Yeah, it is "usually pretty close" to 0 downside
Even Flash of Steel can be unplayable vs Spikers, etc., there are very occasional minor downsides to each

The other thing is that in the base game, there are far more enemies that punish those airy "free" cards like finesse and flash of steel. Most notably the heart and time eater. There are also less ways in the base game to deal with hex from the chosen, which can be a brutal act 2 hallway fight. Downfall as a whole punishes these types of cards much less, which definitely makes the mode more fun, but does make it easier to beat.
Very true

That is true, although I personally find it less fun, but that's because playing a ton of low cost low impact cards in a random order isn't really fun to me. In general if I'm playing more 
than 6 cards per turn consistently and each one isn't a distinct decision whether I want to play it or not, the game gets really boring to me. I'm definitely in the minority with this opinion though, just figured I'd share it to see if anyone else agrees.

I understand and respect the viewpoint, although I am on the opposite "playing a card is fun, so playing lots of cards is lots of fun" side. Ideally, I think, different characters would have different places on that spectrum (as they do in the base game).

I'm fine with playing a lot of cards, as long as the cards being played each actually matter. It's why I hate exotic form snecko with muddle spam, each individual card you play has 0 identity, you just play cards that cost 0.
and as much as I enjoy Guardian, I have gotten to a point in some runs where I just play cards to play cards.
